column4: hey room, does anyone know where the icon files in ubuntu's main menu are located?
I bet this is what youre looking for http://www.violet-rain.info/distributorlogo.html
I don't think that's what I was looking for, I'm trying to replace the icons next to Internet, Applications, etc... in the main menu
ahh
see http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=359280
you can change those using the menu editor, just right click
I'm trying to package an icon set so that others can install it in the themes menu
I need to find the location/name of the files but even the ones in the menu editor aren't right in some cases
I bet theyre somewhere in /usr/share/icons
I've been searching in there
mine are in /usr/share/icons/gnome/24x24
at least the accessories one is, thats the only one I checked
yeah, I've been able to switch most of them but the Internet is proving very elusive
mine is in /usr/share/icons/gnome/24x24/categories
I've changed that file but it still loads up with the old icon
why dont you just change the menu so it points to the icon you want?
because I'm trying to get an icon theme set that others can install
if it was just for myself I'd simply point the menu to the right file but I need to follow standards
I understand, not sure why you would have trouble with that one in particular.
just to let you know I've solved my problem with the icon, looks like one of the resolution sizes hadn't been changed yet
ah. So youre gonna upload an icon theme to gnome-look or something?
I've got a little more to do to the theme before it's ready for upload
well, good luck!
thanks
